Key Match Events: Memphis went on a 10-2 run to take the lead back to 13 with 2:12 left.
Memphis had taken the lead to 13 early in the fourth, its biggest of the game at that point
Pre-Game Insights: With Doncic and Irving both out with injuries, Dallas was missing its top two scorers and 52.4 points a game.
Memphis got in an early deficit with turnovers and poor shooting, but righted things with better control of the offense through the final three quarters.
Post-Match Reflections: Memphis won for the 10th time in the last 11 home games.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Memphis, which is second in the league in points in the paint, finished with 52 points inside and outrebounded Dallas 55-50, including 13 offensive boards.
Others: The Mavericks lost Daniel Gaffor to a left ankle sprain in the second quarter.
Luka Doncic was already out with a left calf strain, and Kyrie Irving will miss time with a bulging disk in his back.
